casebody.data:
Helen Clair CHERRY, a Minor under Fifteen Years of Age, Suing by Her Father, McKinley Cherry, as Next Friend, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 10633. United States Court of Appeals Sixth Circuit Nov. 22, 1948. Taylor & Taylor, of Memphis, Tenn., and E. T. Palmer, of Dyersburg, Tenn., for appellant. Wm. McClanahan, of Memphis, Tenn., for appellee.

Before HICKS, Chief Judge, and MARTIN and McALLISTER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

This cause was heard upon the record and briefs and involves the same question presented in Perry v. United States of America, 6 Cir., 170 F.2d 844, and is affirmed upon the authority of the opinion in that case.
